member.summary: Resolves the setting key.
member.param: An alternate base setting key (used for nested configuration).
member.returns: Setting key.

summary.para: Gets or sets the setting key used to retrieve the setting value. If this value is empty or null, the name of the property is used in conjunction with either: the FullName of the declare type, or the "base setting key" (if the declaring type has an attribute of type defined).

If this setting key is not null, then all configuration classes that inherit from this class will share the same value for the property at runtime (as the lookup key will be the same). This includes configuration classes which declare properties of the type in which this configuration setting is defined.

member.param: The setting value. If null, the setting should be removed from the store.
member.returns: Raw configuration value in string representation.

member.summary: Gets the raw configuration values from the configuration store. member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.Entities.EntityContent
member.summary: The internal representation of storage entity content.
member.remarks: This class allows us to... Deserialize each entity and check it's ContentVersion to determine how to continue with deserialization. Determine which entities need to be upgraded after introducing a new content version. Each child class must specify its default content version, the value of which will be overwritten when deserialized completes. Determine if an entity has been modified with a newer/higher content version to avoid overwriting a newer version of state during a rolling upgrade. e.g. DefaultOperationResultDataProvider and DefaultResourceDataProvider return (409 Conflict) if an attempt is made to read a version that is greater than the current version. Note: Due to the subscription row key changes, DefaultSubscriptionDataProvider currently supports side by side mode during upgrade which means that the current version must read and write the current version and the N-1 version so that any nodes using N-1 will still function during a rolling upgrade. This behavior is needed as current deployed code has no mechanism to return (409 Conflict) requests because a content version is detected. Once we have completed deployment of this change we can drop side by side support and use the same pattern used by DefaultResourceDataProvider and DefaultOperationResultDataProvider.

member.exception: value;ContentVersion must be greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.Extensions.IResourceDataProviderExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for Data Providers interfaces.

This extension method finds resources of the specified resource type at either the subscription level or the resource group level. This method can return very large number of resources. To constrain the number of resources with each request specify the desired value use the 'top' parameter. To page through the resources use the ContinuationToken of the SegmentedResult return object. String comparisons for subscription Id and resource group name, are case-insensitive.
member.param: The resource provider storage object from which to find resources.
Optional. The maximum number of items to enumerate.
member.returns: A with the results of the query.

member.summary: This is a wrapper around FindChildResourcesSegmented, which retrieves the complete list of child resources. Performance: This can retrieve a very large number of resources, so only use when operations need to be applied to the complete list of resources. Avoid sending the complete list in an HTTP response. Large collections must be paged when they are enumerated. String comparisons for subscription Id and resource group name, are case-insensitive.
member.param: The resource provider storage object for which to find resources.
Optional. The maximum number of items to enumerate.
member.returns: A with the results of the query.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.ResourceManagement.ISubscriptionNotificationHandler
member.summary: Interface for implementing subscription change notifications for a resource type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.ResourceManagement.ISubscriptionNotificationHandler.OnSubscriptionNotificationAsync(Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.ResourceManagement.ResourceTypeHandlerConfiguration,Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.Entities.ISubscriptionEntity)
member.summary: Indicates that a subscription notification message was received.
member.returns: SubscriptionNotificationCompletion.Synchronous if the notification has completed synchronously; otherwise SubscriptionNotificationCompletion.Asynchronous.
member.remarks: Subscription notification handling must be goal seeking and must handle concurrent notifications using "last write wins" behavior. Be aware that Delete notifications can be followed by non-Delete notifications. If a notification is not completed synchronously, a secondary notification with the same subscription state may occur after a delay. The handler implementation must poll the subscription state in storage to determine if a new subscription notification has preempted the current notification by comparing the EntityTag property of the subscription entities. If the EntityTag property values do not match or the subscription entity is not found, return . If you insert operation results via IOperationResultDataProvider.InsertOperationResult during a subscription Delete notification you must return SubscriptionNotificationCompletion.Asynchronous; otherwise secondary notifications may not occur and OperationResult entities will be orphaned until grooming Jobs have been implemented.

Be aware that Delete notifications can be followed by non-Delete notifications. If a notification is not completed synchronously, a secondary notification with the same subscription state may occur after a delay. The handler implementation must poll the subscription state in storage to determine if a new subscription notification has preempted the current notification by comparing the EntityTag property of the subscription entities. If the EntityTag property values do not match or the subscription entity is not found, return . If you insert operation results via IOperationResultDataProvider.InsertOperationResult during a subscription Delete notification you must return SubscriptionNotificationCompletion.Asynchronous; otherwise secondary notifications may not occur and OperationResult entities will be orphaned until grooming Jobs have been implemented.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.ResourceManagement.IManagedResourceGroupWideResourceTypeHandler.OnDeleteResourceAsync(Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.Entities.IResourceEntity)
member.summary: Called when a resource is deleted and when a subscription enters the Deleted state.
member.returns: An indicating the status of the operation and the update state of the instance.
member.remarks: A request context is not necessary to delete a resource. Create a Job and return an async response for delete cases that are long running or susceptible to connection issues. e.g. Delete VM when the VM host can be down or restarting down. By default ARM will fail a delete request for a resource if the resource contains child resources. The SDK does not support ARM's cascade delete feature at this time.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.ResourceManagement.IManagedResourceGroupWideResourceTypeHandler.OnSubscriptionNotificationAsync(Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.Entities.ISubscriptionEntity)
member.summary: Called when a subscription notification occurs.
member.returns: SubscriptionNotificationCompletion.Synchronous if the notification has completed synchronously; otherwise SubscriptionNotificationCompletion.Asynchronous.
member.remarks: Subscription notification handling must be goal seeking and must handle concurrent notifications using "last write wins" behavior. Be aware that Delete notifications can be followed by non-Delete notifications. If a notification is not completed synchronously, a secondary notification with the same subscription state may occur after a delay. The handler implementation must poll the subscription state in storage to determine if a new subscription notification has preempted the current notification by comparing the EntityTag property of the subscription entities. If the EntityTag property values do not match or the subscription entity is not found, return . If you leave instances of this resource type in the storage layer after a Delete subscription notification, a warning event will be logged. If you insert operation results via IOperationResultDataProvider.InsertOperationResult during a subscription Delete notification you must return SubscriptionNotificationCompletion.Asynchronous; otherwise secondary notifications may not occur and OperationResult entities will be orphaned until grooming Jobs have been implemented.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.ResourceManagement.ResourceRoutingType
member.summary: The resource routing type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.ResourceManagement.ResourceRoutingType.TenantWide
member.summary: The resource routing type is tenant wide; therefore it spans multiple subscriptions. e.g. providers/{providerNamespace}/{resourceTypeName}
member.remarks: Tenant wide resource types are always considered proxy only resource types. Tenant wide resource types can have an implied instance and don't require CRUD.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.ResourceManagement.ResourceRoutingType.SubscriptionWide
member.summary: The resource routing type is subscription wide; therefore it spans multiple resource groups. e.g. subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/providers/{providerNamespace}/{resourceTypeName}
member.remarks: Subscription wide resource types are always considered proxy only resource types. Subscription wide resource types have an implied instance and don't allow CRUD.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.ResourceManagement.ResourceRoutingType.ResourceGroupWide
member.summary: The resource routing type is resource group wide; therefore instances of it must be contained by a single resource group. e.g. subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{providerNamespace}/{resourceTypeName}/{resourceName}

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.ResourceManagement.ResourceRoutingType.ResourceGroupWideProxyOnly
member.summary: The resource routing type is resource group wide and proxy only; therefore ARM does not track CRUD on the resource type and the resource type is not included in cascade delete operations from ARM.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.Security.AuthorizedCredentials
member.summary: Represents the set of credentials / identities which are authorized to access the resources available on a given endpoint.
Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The authorized basic credentials. Basic authentication credentials will be evaluated using a case-insensitive comparison of the fully-qualified user name (which includes the "domain" property of the network credential if specified) and a case-sensitive comparison of the passwords.
The case-insensitive authorized certificate common names. Certificates attempting to be authorized by common name will be validated for trusted issuer signature and revocation.

The case-insensitive authorized first-party certificate thumbprints. First-party certificates attempting to be authorized by thumbprint will not be validated for trusted issuer signature or revocation.
The case-insensitive authorized first-party certificate thumbprints. Third-party certificates attempting to be authorized by thumbprint will be validated for trusted issuer signature and revocation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.Security.AuthorizedCredentials.Empty
member.summary: Gets a default (empty) authorized credential set. This credential set can be used to authorize anonymous requests (without credentials).
member.remarks: A new instance is returned for each reference.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.Security.AuthorizedCredentials.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is empty of credentials.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.Security.AuthorizedCredentials.BasicCredentials
member.summary: Gets the authorized credentials (Basic Authentication).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.Security.AuthorizedCredentials.CertificateCommonNames
member.summary: Gets the case-insensitive common names of authorized certificates. Certificates authorized by common names will be validated for trusted issuer signatures and checked for revocation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.Security.AuthorizedCredentials.FirstPartyCertificateThumbprints
member.summary: Gets the case-insensitive thumbprints of authorized first-party certificates. First-party certificates explicitly authorized by thumbprint will not be validated for trusted issuer signatures or checked for revocation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.Security.AuthorizedCredentials.ThirdPartyCertificateThumbprints
member.summary: Gets the case-insensitive thumbprints of authorized third-party certificates. Third-party certificates authorized by thumbprint will be validated for trusted issuer signatures and checked for revocation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.Security.AuthorizedCredentials.WindowsUsers
member.summary: Gets the case-insensitive usernames of authorized windows users. The specified windows users will be granted access to the endpoint.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.Security.AuthorizedCredentials.WindowsGroups
member.summary: Gets the case-insensitive names of authorized windows groups. Any windows users with membership in at least one of the specified groups will be granted access to the endpoint.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.Security.AuthorizedCredentials.AllowsThirdPartyCertificatesByThumbprint
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this endpoint specifies configuration to allow certificate authentication for a specific third-party certificate.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.Security.AuthorizedCredentials.AllowsWindowsAuthentication
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this endpoint specifies configuration to allow windows authentication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.Security.AuthorizedCredentials.AllowsWindowsGroups

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.ResourceProviderEventSource
member.summary: The resource provider trace.
member.remarks: The user-friendly localized event messages are defined in EventSourceErrorMessages resource file (fully localizable .NET Resources file). The resource naming convention for event messages is: "event_(TraceMethodName)", where (TraceMethodName) is the name of the respective event method. E.g. The ActivityStart event method will have the message defined by the EventSourceErrorMessage.event_ActivityStart property.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.ResourceProvider.ResourceProviderEventSource.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. By default calling the 'WriteEvent' methods do NOT throw on errors (they silently discard the event). This is because in most cases users assume logging is not 'precious' and do NOT wish to have logging failures crash the program. However for those applications where logging is 'precious' and if it fails the caller wishes to react, setting 'throwOnEventWriteErrors' will cause an exception to be thrown if WriteEvent fails. Note the fact that EventWrite succeeds does not necessarily mean that the event reached its destination only that operation of writing it did not fail.
member.param: Indicate if logging inputs should be validated
